If you live near Brighton, it would great to see you for the art opening. There will lots of "treats" too served by the famous bakery.

Athans Bakery in Brighton Center has been transformed into an art gallery and is presenting an art exhibition of Israeli artist Shoshana Ernst and her daughter Tal. A free opening reception is Sunday December 4 from 6-8:30 pm.  They will be serving many of the famous treats to complement Shoshana's and Tal's very colorful and amazing landscape paintings.

 

Athans European Bakery & Cafe’, which opened in Historic Brighton Center in 2007 at 407 Washington Street, is pleased to present an art exhibition Shoshana & Tal Ernst: Stirrings in  Stillness as its establishment is transformed into an art gallery. The opening reception with refreshments from this very popular bakery is Sunday, December 4th from 6:00-8:30 pm.  This is an exhibition featuring Brighton artist Shoshana Ernst and her daughter Tal with older and  recent artworks on the theme of stillness of life and nature.  Their joint artist statement for this exhibition simply says: “sounds of the field carry with them smell, taste and melody of longing”.  The paintings include many stunning landscapes that are both representational and non-representational.   Shoshana uses brilliant colors and imaginary visions that resemble landscapes and views into another world.  Together they present a group of paintings that demand that the viewer look deep into their own spirits for completeness. The exhibition runsthrough February 29, 2012.
item.name: Art Exhibit Opening at Athans in Brighton
